Part I Writing (30 minutes)

Directions: For this part, you are allowed 30 minutes to write an essay titled "The Importance of Developing Digital Literacy". You should write at least 120 words but no more than 180 words.

Part II Listening Comprehension (25 minutes)

Section A - News Report

Questions 1 and 2 are based on the news report you have just heard.

1. What is the main topic of the news report?

A) The rising cost of living in major cities.
B) The impact of remote work on urban areas.
C) New housing policies introduced by the government.
D) The decline in urban population growth.

2. According to the report, what might be a consequence?

A) It will create more job opportunities.
B) It may lead to infrastructure challenges.
C) It will reduce traffic congestion.
D) It could lower housing prices.

Part III Reading Comprehension (40 minutes)

Section A - Reading in Depth

Passage One

In recent years, the concept of "digital detox" has gained significant popularity. People are increasingly aware of the negative effects of excessive screen time and constant connectivity. A digital detox involves taking a break from electronic devices such as smartphones, computers, and tablets for a certain period.

Research shows that excessive use of digital devices can lead to various problems including eye strain, sleep disturbances, and reduced face-to-face social interactions. Moreover, constant notifications and the pressure to stay connected can contribute to stress and anxiety.

Many individuals who have tried digital detox report feeling more relaxed, having better sleep quality, and experiencing improved relationships with family and friends. Some companies have even started implementing "no-device" policies during meetings to encourage better focus and communication.

26. What is the main idea of the passage?

A) The benefits of using digital devices
B) The growing trend of digital detox
C) How to use smartphones effectively
D) The history of electronic devices

27. According to the passage, which is NOT mentioned as a problem caused by excessive device use?

A) Eye strain
B) Weight gain
C) Sleep disturbances
D) Reduced social interactions
